title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response identifies the civil liberty that is common in both Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission (2010) and McCutcheon v. Federal Election Commission (2013).

For Task B1, the response must describe relevant information from the required Supreme Court case.

For Task B2, the response must explain how the decision in Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission relates to the reasoning in McCutcheon v. Federal Election Commission.

Task B is worth 2 points. If the response accomplishes the task in B1, the response earns 1 point. If the response accomplishes the task in B2, the response will earn 2 points.

For Task C, the response must explain how the decision in McCutcheon v. Federal Election Commission can be used to support the participatory, pluralist, or elite model of democracy.

Points for Task A, Task B, and Task C are earned independently.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the following tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes TWO of Task A, Task B1, or Task C or just Task B2.
The response accomplishes Task A, Task B1, and Task C or Task B2 and Task A, or Task B2 and Task C.
The response accomplishes Tasks A, B2, and C.
